title: Please help me identify 2 fonts
author: Riswan

comments.content:
The script is Polonaise D Bold:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/polonaise/urw-d-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317144407/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/polonaise/urw-d-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/polonaise/urw-d-bold/")

EDITED:

Divyanka appears to be J-Phont, which is a pirated version of Chicago (Apple Computers):

[https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/chicago/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317144407/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/chicago/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/chicago/")

> Divyanka is J-Phont

Which looks just like slanted Chicago.

I agree with Riccardo that Divyanka is based on a sloped Chicago ©. Here is Chicago © with a 10 degree slope.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317144407im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ChicagoSloped10degInUse_5433.jpg)
  
Chicago © is copyright 1992 by Apple Computer and the digital outlines are protected under copyright law. We should not encourage piracy by linking to pirate fonts like J-Phont.  
Don

BTW I note that J-Phont has more of a slope than Divyanka.  
Don
Don, I didn't knowingly do so--I didn't recognize it.

Kevin, I have inadvertently done the same thing myself. My comment was meant as a general suggestion to all posters and not meant to be a criticism of you. You edited out the link, which all that any of us can do in these cases.  
Cheers.  
Don
